p:
At the time of writing this article, on May 17, Italy had reported 223,885 cases of COVID-19. However, after so much desolation, the number of deaths, which in one day almost reached the quota of 1,000, began to fall to less than 200
4 , as did the ICU admissions. Restrictive measures, however late, may have prevented the deaths of 38,000 [13,000-84,000] Italians, according to estimates by the Imperial College
14 .
